Package edu.jhu.coe.classify

Interface Summary
Classifier<I,L> Classifiers assign labels to instances.
ClassifierFactory<I,L> Classifier factories construct classifiers from training instances.
FeatureExtractor<I,O> Feature extractors process input instances into feature counters.
FeatureVector<F> A FeatureVector is a collection of features.
LabeledFeatureVector<F,L> LabeledDatums add a label to the basic FeatureVector interface.
ProbabilisticClassifier<I,L> Probabilistic classifiers assign distributions over labels to instances.
ProbabilisticClassifierFactory<I,L> Probabilistic classifier factories construct probabilistic classifiers from training instances.
 

Class Summary
BasicFeatureVector<F> Simple Class implementing FeatureVector
BasicLabeledFeatureVector<F,L> A minimal implementation of a labeled datum, wrapping a list of features and a label.
Feature  
FeatureManager  
LabeledInstance<I,L> LabeledInstances are input instances along with a label.
LabelFeatureWeightsManager<L> When you have features that are annotated with labels, use this as a feature manager.
LinearRegression<I>  
LinearRegression.Factory<I>  
MaximumEntropyClassifier<I,F,L> Maximum entropy classifier for assignment 2.
MaximumEntropyClassifier.EncodedDatum EncodedDatums are sparse representations of (labeled) feature count vectors for a given data point.
MaximumEntropyClassifier.Encoding<F,L> The Encoding maintains correspondences between the various representions of the data, labels, and features.
MaximumEntropyClassifier.Factory<I,F,L> Factory for training MaximumEntropyClassifiers.
MaximumEntropyClassifier.IndexLinearizer The IndexLinearizer maintains the linearization of the two-dimensional features-by-labels pair space.
MaximumEntropyClassifier.ObjectiveFunction<F,L> This is the MaximumEntropy objective function: the (negative) log conditional likelihood of the training data, possibly with a penalty for large weights.
NaiveBayesClassifier<I,F,L>  
NaiveBayesClassifier.Factory<I,F,L>
